de.sub.goobi.forms

Class CalendarForm

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.sub.goobi.forms.CalendarForm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    @Named(value="CalendarForm")
 @SessionScoped
public class CalendarForm
extends Object
implements Serializable
    The class CalendarForm provides the screen logic for a JSF calendar editor to enter the course of appearance of a newspaper.
    Author:
    Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CalendarForm.Cell
      The class Cell represents a single table cell on the calendar sheet.
      class  CalendarForm.IssueController
      The class IssueController backs the control elements that are necessary to manage the properties of an issue using Faces, including the option of its deletion.
      static class  CalendarForm.IssueOption
      The class IssuesOption represents the option that an Issue may have been issued on a certain day in history.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Map<String,Block> blockChangerResolver
      The Map blockChangerResolver is populated with the IDs used in the block changer drop down element and the references to the block objects referenced by the IDs for easily looking them up upon change.

      The field blockChangerUnchanged is of importance during the update model values phase of the JSF life-cycle.

      The field blockShowing holds the block currently showing in this calendar instance.
      protected Course course
      The field course holds the course of appearance currently under edit by this calendar form instance.

      The constant field ISSUE_COLOURS holds the colours used to represent the issues in the calendar editor.
      protected org.apache.myfaces.custom.fileupload.UploadedFile uploadedFile 
      protected boolean uploadShowing
      The field uploadShowing indicates whether the dialogue box to upload a course of appearance XML description is showing or not.
      protected int yearShowing
      The field yearShowing tells the year currently showing in this calendar instance.

    • Field Detail

      • ISSUE_COLOURS

        protected static String[] ISSUE_COLOURS
        The constant field ISSUE_COLOURS holds the colours used to represent the issues in the calendar editor. It is populated on form bean creation, so changing the configuration should take effect without need to restart the servlet container.

      • blockChangerResolver

        protected Map<String,Block> blockChangerResolver
        The Map blockChangerResolver is populated with the IDs used in the block changer drop down element and the references to the block objects referenced by the IDs for easily looking them up upon change.

      • blockChangerUnchanged

        protected boolean blockChangerUnchanged
        The field blockChangerUnchanged is of importance during the update model values phase of the JSF life-cycle. During that phase several setter methods are sequentially called. The first method called is setBlockChangerSelected(). If the user chose a different block to be displayed, blockShowing will be altered. This would cause the subsequent calls to other setter methods to overwrite the values in the newly selected block with the values of the previously displayed block which come back in in the form that is submitted by the browser if this is not blocked. Therefore setBlockChangerSelected() sets blockChangerUnchanged to control whether the other setter methods shall or shall not write the incoming data into the respective fields.

      • blockShowing

        protected Block blockShowing
        The field blockShowing holds the block currently showing in this calendar instance. The block held in blockShowing must be part of the course object, too.

      • course

        protected Course course
        The field course holds the course of appearance currently under edit by this calendar form instance.

      • uploadedFile

        protected org.apache.myfaces.custom.fileupload.UploadedFile uploadedFile

      • uploadShowing

        protected boolean uploadShowing
        The field uploadShowing indicates whether the dialogue box to upload a course of appearance XML description is showing or not.

      • yearShowing

        protected int yearShowing
        The field yearShowing tells the year currently showing in this calendar instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalendarForm

        public CalendarForm()
        Empty constructor. Creates a new form without yet any data.

        The issue colour presets are samples which have been chosen to provide distinguishability also for users with red-green color vision deficiency. Arbitrary colours can be defined in kitodo_config.properties by setting the property “issue.colours”.

    • Method Detail

      • addIssueClick

        public void addIssueClick()
        The method addIssueClick() adds a new issue to the set of issues held by the block currently showing.

      • backwardClick

        public void backwardClick()
        The method backwardClick() flips the calendar sheet back one year in time.

      • buildIssueOptions

        protected List<CalendarForm.IssueOption> buildIssueOptions(List<CalendarForm.IssueController> issueControllers,
                                                           org.joda.time.LocalDate date)
        The function buildIssueOptions() creates a list of issueOptions for a given date.
        Parameters:
        issueControllers - the list of issue controllers in question
        date - the date in question
        Returns:
        a list of issue options for the date

      • copyBlockClick

        public void copyBlockClick()
        The method copyBlockClick() creates and adds a copy of the currently showing block.

      • downloadClick

        public void downloadClick()
        The function downloadClick() is executed if the user clicks the action link to “export” the calendar data. If the course of appearance doesn’t yet contain generated processes—which is always the case, except that the user just came from uploading a data file and didn’t change anything about it—process data will be generated. Then an XML file will be made out of it and sent to the user’s browser. If the granularity was temporarily added, it will be removed afterwards so that the user will not be presented with the option to generate processes “as imported” if he or she never ran an import before.

        Note: The process data will be generated with a granularity of “days” (each day forms one process). This setting can be changed later after the data has been re-imported, but it will remain if the user uploads the saved data and then proceeds right to the next page and creates processes with the granularity “as imported”. However, since this is possible and—as to our knowledge in late 2014, when this was written—this is the best option of all, this default has been chosen here.

      • forwardClick

        public void forwardClick()
        The method forwardClick() flips the calendar sheet forward one year in time.

      • getBlank

        public boolean getBlank()
        The function getBlank() returns whether the calendar editor is in mint condition, i.e. there is no block defined yet, as read-only property “blank”.

        Side note: “empty” is a reserved word in JSP and cannot be used as property name.

        Returns:
        whether there is no block yet

      • getBlockChangerOptions

        public List<Map<String,String>> getBlockChangerOptions()
        The function getBlockChangerOptions() returns the elements for the block changer drop down element as read only property "blockChangerOptions". It returns a List of Map with each two entries: "value" and "label". "value" is the hashCode() in hex of the block which will later be used if the field "blockChangerSelected" is altered to choose the currently selected block, "label" is the readable description to be shown to the user.
        Returns:
        the elements for the block changer drop down element

      • getBlockChangerSelected

        public String getBlockChangerSelected()
        The function getBlockChangerSelected() returns the hashCode() value of the block currently selected as read-write property "blockChangerSelected". If a new block is under edit, returns the empty String.
        Returns:
        identifier of the selected block

      • getCalendarSheet

        public List<List<CalendarForm.Cell>> getCalendarSheet()
        The function getCalendarSheet() returns the data required to build the calendar sheet as read-only property "calendarSheet". The outer list contains 31 entries, each representing a row of the calendar (the days 1−31), each line then contains 12 cells representing the months. This is due to HTML table being produced line by line.
        Returns:
        the table cells to build the calendar sheet

      • getCourse

        public Course getCourse()
        The function getCourse() will return the course created with this editor as read-only property "course" to pass it to the next form.
        Returns:
        the course of appearance data model

      • getEmptySheet

        protected List<List<CalendarForm.Cell>> getEmptySheet()
        The function getEmptySheet() builds the empty calendar sheet with 31 rows of twelve cells with empty objects of type Cell().
        Returns:
        an empty calendar sheet

      • getFirstAppearance

        public String getFirstAppearance()
        The function getFirstAppearance() returns the date of first appearance of the block currently showing as read-write property "firstAppearance".
        Returns:
        date of first appearance of currently showing block

      • getIssues

        public List<CalendarForm.IssueController> getIssues()
        The function getIssues() returns the list of issues held by the block currently showing as read-only property "issues".
        Returns:
        the list of issues

        public String getLastAppearance()
        The function getLastAppearance() returns the date of last appearance of the block currently showing as read-write property "lastAppearance".
        Returns:
        date of last appearance of currently showing block

      • getUploadedFile

        public org.apache.myfaces.custom.fileupload.UploadedFile getUploadedFile()
        The function getUploadedFile() is the getter method for the property "uploadedFile" which is write-only, however Faces requires is.
        Returns:
        always null

      • getUploadShowing

        public boolean getUploadShowing()
        The function getUploadShowing() returns whether the dialog to upload a course of appearance XML file shall be shown or not.
        Returns:
        whether the dialog to upload a course of appearance shows

      • getYear

        public String getYear()
        The function getYear() returns the year to be shown in the calendar sheet as read-only property "year".
        Returns:
        the year to show on the calendar sheet

      • hideUploadClick

        public void hideUploadClick()
        The method hideUploadClick() will be called by Faces if the user clicks the cancel button leave the dialog to upload a course of appearance XML file.

      • navigate

        protected void navigate()
        The method navigate() alters the year the calendar sheet is shown for so that something of the current block is visible to prevent the user from needing to click through centuries manually to get there.

      • neglectEmptyBlock

        protected void neglectEmptyBlock()
        The function neglectEmptyBlock() removes an empty block. Usually, an empty block cannot be created. But if the user clicks the upload dialog button, the form must be submitted, which causes the setters of the form fields to create one prior to the function call. To stay consistent, it is removed here again.

      • nextClick

        public String nextClick()
        The function nextClick() is executed if the user clicks the button to go to the next screen. It returns either the String constant that indicates Faces the next screen, or sets an error message if the user didn’t yet input an issue and indicates Faces to stay on that screen by returning the empty string.
        Returns:
        the screen to show next

      • populateByCalendar

        protected void populateByCalendar(List<List<CalendarForm.Cell>> sheet)
        The method populateByCalendar() populates an empty calendar sheet by iterating on LocalDate.
        Parameters:
        sheet - calendar sheet to populate

      • removeBlockClick

        public void removeBlockClick()
        The method removeBlockClick() deletes the currently selected block from the course of appearance. If there is only one block left, the editor will instead be reset.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the block referenced by “blockShowing” isn’t contained in the course of appearance

      • setBlockChangerSelected

        public void setBlockChangerSelected(String value)
        The method setBlockChangerSelected() will be called by Faces to store a new value of the read-write property "blockChangerSelected". If it is different from the current one, this means that the user selected a different Block in the block changer drop down element. The event will be used to alter the “blockShowing” field which keeps the block currently showing. “updateAllowed” will be set accordingly to update the contents of the current block or to prevent fields containing data from the previously displaying block to overwrite the data inside the newly selected one.
        Parameters:
        value - hashCode() in hex of the block to be selected

      • setFirstAppearance

        public void setFirstAppearance(String firstAppearance)
        The method setFirstAppearance() will be called by Faces to store a new value of the read-write property "firstAppearance", which represents the date of first appearance of the block currently showing. The event will be used to either alter the date of first appearance of the block defined by the “blockShowing” field or, in case that a new block is under edit, to initially set its the date of first appearance.
        Parameters:
        firstAppearance - new date of first appearance

      • setLastAppearance

        public void setLastAppearance(String lastAppearance)
        The method setLastAppearance() will be called by Faces to store a new value of the read-write property "lastAppearance", which represents the date of last appearance of the block currently showing. The event will be used to either alter the date of last appearance of the block defined by the “blockShowing” field or, in case that a new block is under edit, to initially set its the date of last appearance.
        Parameters:
        lastAppearance - new date of last appearance

      • setUploadedFile

        public void setUploadedFile(org.apache.myfaces.custom.fileupload.UploadedFile data)
        The method setUploadedFile() will be called by Faces to store the new value of the read-write property "uploadedFile", which is a reference to the binary data the user provides for upload.
        Parameters:
        data - the UploadedFile object generated by the Tomahawk library

      • showUploadClick

        public void showUploadClick()
        The method showUploadClick() will be called by Faces if the user clicks the button to upload a course of appearance XML file.

      • uploadClick

        public void uploadClick()
        The method uploadClick() will be called by Faces if the user has selected a course of appearance XML file for upload in the window and clicks the button to upload it. Old values of the granularity picker are removed—if any—so that the screen is reinitialised with the current calendar state next time.
